info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 4:53PM EDT until July 12 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of eastern New York, including the following county, Herkimer.
* WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 PM EDT, Trained weather spotters and doppler radar reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to slow moving showers and thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ilion, Herkimer, Little Falls, Mohawk, Frankfort, Jordanville, Elizabethtown, Fort Herkimer, East Herkimer, Jacksonburg, Days Rock, Edicks, Paines Hollow, Kast Bridge, Eatonville, North Ilion, Kelhi Corners, Dennison Corners, Kingdom and Wrights Corners. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING
